   20: -module(epp_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: 
   24: -export([rec_1/1, include_local/1, predef_mac/1,
   25: 	 upcase_mac_1/1, upcase_mac_2/1,
   26: 	 variable_1/1, otp_4870/1, otp_4871/1, otp_5362/1,
   27:          pmod/1, not_circular/1, skip_header/1, otp_6277/1, gh_4995/1, otp_7702/1,
   28:          otp_8130/1, overload_mac/1, otp_8388/1, otp_8470/1,
   29:          otp_8562/1, otp_8665/1, otp_8911/1, otp_10302/1, otp_10820/1,
   30:          otp_11728/1, encoding/1, extends/1,  function_macro/1,
   31: 	 test_error/1, test_warning/1, otp_14285/1,
   32: 	 test_if/1,source_name/1,otp_16978/1,otp_16824/1,scan_file/1,file_macro/1,
   33:          deterministic_include/1, nondeterministic_include/1,
   34:          gh_8268/1
   35:         ]).
   36: 
   37: -export([epp_parse_erl_form/2]).
   38: 
   39: %%
   40: %% Define to run outside of test server
   41: %%
   42: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   43: 
   44: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   45: -compile(export_all).
   46: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   47: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   48: %% -define(t, test_server).
   49: -define(t, io).
   50: config(priv_dir, _) ->
   51:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_priv");
   52: config(data_dir, _) ->
   53:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_data").
   54: -else.
   55: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   56: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   57: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   58: 
   59: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   63:     ok.
   64: -endif.
   65: 
   66: suite() ->
   67:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   68:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   69: 
   70: all() ->
   71:     [rec_1, {group, upcase_mac}, include_local, predef_mac,
   72:      {group, variable}, otp_4870, otp_4871, otp_5362, pmod,
   73:      not_circular, skip_header, otp_6277, gh_4995, otp_7702, otp_8130,
   74:      overload_mac, otp_8388, otp_8470, otp_8562,
   75:      otp_8665, otp_8911, otp_10302, otp_10820, otp_11728,
   76:      encoding, extends, function_macro, test_error, test_warning,
   77:      otp_14285, test_if, source_name, otp_16978, otp_16824, scan_file, file_macro,
   78:      deterministic_include, nondeterministic_include,
   79:      gh_8268].
   80: 
   81: groups() ->
   82:     [{upcase_mac, [], [upcase_mac_1, upcase_mac_2]},
   83:      {variable, [], [variable_1]}].
   84: 
   85: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   86:     Config.
   87: 
   88: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   92:     Config.
   93: 
   94: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   95:     Config.
   96: 
   97: %% Recursive macros hang or crash epp (OTP-1398).
   98: rec_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac.erl"),
  100:     {ok, List} = epp_parse_file(File, [], []),
  101:     %% we should encounter errors
  102:     {value, _} = lists:keysearch(error, 1, List),
  103:     check_errors(List),
  104:     ok.
  105: 
  106: include_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  107:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  108:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "include_local.erl"),
  109:     FooHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","foo.hrl"]),
  110:     BarHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","bar.hrl"]),
  111:     %% include_local.erl includes include/foo.hrl which
  112:     %% includes bar.hrl (also in include/) without requiring
  113:     %% any additional include path, and overriding any file
  114:     %% of the same name that the path points to
  115:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [DataDir], []),
  116:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{true,true}}} =
  117: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  118:     [{File,1},{FooHrl,1},{BarHrl,1},{FooHrl,5},{File,5}] =
  119:         [ FileLine || {attribute,_,file,FileLine} <- List ],
  120:     ok.
  121: 
  122: file_macro(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  124:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "file_macro.erl"),
  125:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  126:                                        {source_name, "Other source"}]),
  127:     %% Both attribute a and b are defined as ?FILE, they should be the same
  128:     {attribute,_,a,FileA} = lists:keyfind(a, 3, List),
  129:     {attribute,_,b,FileB} = lists:keyfind(b, 3, List),
  130:     "Other source" = FileA = FileB,
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  135:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  136:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  137:                                        {deterministic, true},
  138:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  139: 
  140:     %% In deterministic mode, only basenames, rather than full paths, should
  141:     %% be written to the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  142:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  143:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"baz.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  144:                        (_) -> false
  145:                      end,
  146:                      List),
  147:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  148:             "including baz.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  149:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  150:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"file.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  151:                        (_) -> false
  152:                      end,
  153:                      List),
  154:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  155:             "including file.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: nondeterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  160:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  161:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  162:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  163: 
  164:     %% Outside of deterministic mode, full paths, should be written to
  165:     %% the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  166:     %% to make debugging easier.
  167:     %% We don't try to assume what the full absolute path will be in the
  168:     %% unit test, since that can depend on the environment and how the
  169:     %% test is executed. Instead, we just look for whether there is
  170:     %% the parent directory along with the basename at least.
  171:     IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","baz.hrl"),
  172:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  173:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_Line}}) ->
  174:                          lists:suffix(IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  175:                        (_) -> false
  176:                      end,
  177:                      List),
  178:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  179:             "including baz.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  180:     IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","file.hrl"),
  181:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  182:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_line}}) ->
  183:                          lists:suffix(IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  184:                        (_) -> false
  185:                      end,
  186:                      List),
  187:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  188:             "including file.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  189:     ok.
  190: 
  191: %%% Here is a little reimplementation of epp:parse_file, which times out
  192: %%% after 4 seconds if the epp server doesn't respond. If we use the
  193: %%% regular epp:parse_file, the test case will time out, and then epp
  194: %%% server will go on growing until we dump core.
  195: epp_parse_file(File, Inc, Predef) ->
  196:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  197: 				     epp:open(File, Inc, Predef)
  198: 			     end),
  199:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  200: 				     Opts = [{name, File},
  201: 					     {includes, Inc},
  202: 					     {macros, Predef}],
  203: 				     epp:open(Opts)
  204: 			     end),
  205:     {ok, List}.
  206: 
  207: do_epp_parse_file(Open) ->
  208:     {ok, Epp} = Open(),
  209:     List = collect_epp_forms(Epp),
  210:     epp:close(Epp),
  211:     List.
  212: 
  213: collect_epp_forms(Epp) ->
  214:     Result = epp_parse_erl_form(Epp),
  215:     case Result of
  216: 	{error, _Error} ->
  217: 	    [Result | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  218: 	{ok, Form} ->
  219: 	    [Form | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  220: 	{eof, _} ->
  221: 	    [Result]
  222:     end.
  223: 
  224: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp) ->
  225:     P = spawn(?MODULE, epp_parse_erl_form, [Epp, self()]),
  226:     receive
  227: 	{P, Result} ->
  228: 	    Result
  229:     after 4000 ->
  230: 	    exit(Epp, kill),
  231: 	    exit(P, kill),
  232: 	    timeout
  233:     end.
  234: 
  235: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp, Parent) ->
  236:     Parent ! {self(), epp:parse_erl_form(Epp)}.
  237: 
  238: check_errors([]) ->
  239:     ok;
  240: check_errors([{error, Info} | Rest]) ->
  241:     {Line, Mod, Desc} = Info,
  242:     case Line of
  243: 	I when is_integer(I) -> ok;
  244: 	{L,C} when is_integer(L), is_integer(C), C >= 1 -> ok
  245:     end,
  246:     Str = lists:flatten(Mod:format_error(Desc)),
  247:     [Str] = io_lib:format("~s", [Str]),
  248:     check_errors(Rest);
  249: check_errors([_ | Rest]) ->
  250:     check_errors(Rest).
  251: 
  252: 
  253: upcase_mac_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  255:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  256:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  257:     Tuple = {1, 1, 3, 3},
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: upcase_mac_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  261:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  262:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], [{p, 5}, {'P', 6}]),
  263:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  264:     Tuple = {5, 5, 6, 6},
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: predef_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  268:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac3.erl"),
  269:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  270:     [_,
  271:      {attribute, Anno, l, Line1},
  272:      {attribute, _, f, File},
  273:      {attribute, _, machine1, _},
  274:      {attribute, _, module, mac3},
  275:      {attribute, _, m, mac3},
  276:      {attribute, _, ms, "mac3"},
  277:      {attribute, _, machine2, _}
  278:      | _] = List,
  279:     Line1 = erl_anno:line(Anno),
  280:     ok.
  281: 
  282: variable_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  283:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  284:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "variable_1.erl"),
  285:     true = os:putenv("VAR", DataDir),
  286:     %% variable_1.erl includes variable_1_include.hrl and
  287:     %% variable_1_include_dir.hrl.
  288:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  289:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{value1,value2}}} =
  290: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: %% undef without module declaration.
  294: otp_4870(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     Ts = [{otp_4870,
  296:            <<"-undef(foo).
  297:            ">>,
  298:            []}],
  299:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: %% crashing erl_scan
  303: otp_4871(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  305:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_4871.erl"),
  306:     ok = file:write_file(File, "-module(otp_4871)."),
  307:     %% Testing crash in erl_scan. Unfortunately there currently is
  308:     %% no known way to crash erl_scan so it is emulated by killing the
  309:     %% file io server. This assumes lots of things about how
  310:     %% the processes are started and how monitors are set up,
  311:     %% so there are some sanity checks before killing.
  312:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  313:     timer:sleep(1),
  314:     true = current_module(Epp, epp),
  315:     {monitored_by,[Io]} = process_info(Epp, monitored_by),
  316:     true = current_module(Io, file_io_server),
  317:     exit(Io, emulate_crash),
  318:     timer:sleep(1),
  319:     {error,{_Line,epp,cannot_parse}} = otp_4871_parse_file(Epp),
  320:     epp:close(Epp),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: current_module(Pid, Mod) ->
  324:     {current_function, {Mod, _, _}} = process_info(Pid, current_function),
  325:     true.
  326: 
  327: otp_4871_parse_file(Epp) ->
  328:     case epp:parse_erl_form(Epp) of
  329: 	{ok,_} -> otp_4871_parse_file(Epp);
  330: 	Other -> Other
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: %% OTP-5362. The -file attribute is recognized.
  334: otp_5362(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  335:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  336: 
  337:     Copts = [return, strong_validation,{i,Dir}],
  338: 
  339:     File_Incl = filename:join(Dir, "incl_5362.erl"),
  340:     File_Incl2 = filename:join(Dir, "incl2_5362.erl"),
  341:     File_Incl3 = filename:join(Dir, "incl3_5362.erl"),
  342:     Incl = <<"-module(incl_5362).
  343: 
  344:               -include(\"incl2_5362.erl\").
  345: 
  346:               -include_lib(\"incl3_5362.erl\").
  347: 
  348:               hi(There) -> % line 7
  349:                    a.
  350:            ">>,
  351:     Incl2 = <<"-file(\"some.file\", 100).
  352: 
  353:                foo(Bar) -> % line 102
  354:                    foo.
  355:             ">>,
  356:     Incl3 = <<"glurk(Foo) -> % line 1
  357:                   bar.
  358:             ">>,
  359:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl, Incl),
  360:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl2, Incl2),
  361:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl3, Incl3),
  362: 
  363:     {ok, incl_5362, InclWarnings} = compile:file(File_Incl, Copts),
  364:     true = message_compare(
  365:                    [{File_Incl3,[{{1,1},erl_lint,{unused_function,{glurk,1}}},
  366:                                  {{1,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Foo'}}]},
  367:                     {File_Incl,[{{7,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{hi,1}}},
  368:                                 {{7,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'There'}}]},
  369:                     {"some.file",[{{102,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{foo,1}}},
  370:                                   {{102,20},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Bar'}}]}],
  371:                    lists:usort(InclWarnings)),
  372: 
  373:     file:delete(File_Incl),
  374:     file:delete(File_Incl2),
  375:     file:delete(File_Incl3),
  376: 
  377:     %% A -file attribute referring back to the including file.
  378:     File_Back = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.erl"),
  379:     File_Back_hrl = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.hrl"),
  380:     Back = <<"-module(back_5362).
  381: 
  382:               -export([foo/1]).
  383: 
  384:               -file(?FILE, 1).
  385:               -include(\"back_5362.hrl\").
  386: 
  387:               foo(V) -> % line 4
  388:                   bar.
  389:               ">>,
  390:     Back_hrl = [<<"
  391:                   -file(\"">>,File_Back,<<"\", 2).
  392:                  ">>],
  393: 
  394:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back, Back),
  395:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back_hrl, list_to_binary(Back_hrl)),
  396: 
  397:     {ok, back_5362, BackWarnings} = compile:file(File_Back, Copts),
  398:     true = message_compare(
  399:                    [{File_Back,[{{4,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'V'}}]}],
  400:                    BackWarnings),
  401:     file:delete(File_Back),
  402:     file:delete(File_Back_hrl),
  403: 
  404:     %% Set filename but keep line.
  405:     File_Change = filename:join(Dir, "change_5362.erl"),
  406:     Change = [<<"-module(change_5362).
  407: 
  408:                 -file(?FILE, 100).
  409: 
  410:                 -export([foo/1,bar/1]).
  411: 
  412:                 -file(\"other.file\", ?LINE). % like an included file...
  413:                 foo(A) -> % line 105
  414:                     bar.
  415: 
  416:                 -file(\"">>,File_Change,<<"\", 1000).
  417: 
  418:                 bar(B) -> % line 1002
  419:                     foo.
  420:               ">>],
  421: 
  422:     ok = file:write_file(File_Change, list_to_binary(Change)),
  423: 
  424:     {ok, change_5362, ChangeWarnings} =
  425:         compile:file(File_Change, Copts),
  426:     true = message_compare(
  427:                    [{File_Change,[{{1002,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]},
  428:                     {"other.file",[{{105,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}],
  429:                    lists:usort(ChangeWarnings)),
  430: 
  431:     file:delete(File_Change),
  432: 
  433:     %% -file attribute ending with a blank (not a newline).
  434:     File_Blank = filename:join(Dir, "blank_5362.erl"),
  435: 
  436:     Blank = <<"-module(blank_5362).
  437: 
  438:                -export([q/1,a/1,b/1,c/1]).
  439: 
  440:                -
  441:                file(?FILE, 18). q(Q) -> foo. % line 18
  442: 
  443:                a(A) -> % line 20
  444:                    1.
  445: 
  446:                -file(?FILE, 42).
  447: 
  448:                b(B) -> % line 44
  449:                    2.
  450: 
  451:                -file(?FILE, ?LINE). c(C) -> % line 47
  452:                    3.
  453:             ">>,
  454:     ok = file:write_file(File_Blank, Blank),
  455:     {ok, blank_5362, BlankWarnings} = compile:file(File_Blank, Copts),
  456:     true = message_compare(
  457:              [{File_Blank,[{{18,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}},
  458:                            {{20,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}},
  459:                            {{44,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  460:                            {{47,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C'}}]}],
  461:               lists:usort(BlankWarnings)),
  462:     file:delete(File_Blank),
  463: 
  464:     %% __FILE__ is set by inclusion and by -file attribute
  465:     FILE_incl = filename:join(Dir, "file_5362.erl"),
  466:     FILE_incl1 = filename:join(Dir, "file_incl_5362.erl"),
  467:     FILE = <<"-module(file_5362).
  468: 
  469:               -export([ff/0, ii/0]).
  470: 
  471:               -include(\"file_incl_5362.erl\").
  472: 
  473:               -file(\"other_file\", 100).
  474: 
  475:               ff() ->
  476:                   ?FILE.">>,
  477:     FILE1 = <<"ii() -> ?FILE.
  478:               ">>,
  479:     FILE_Mod = file_5362,
  480:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl, FILE),
  481:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl1, FILE1),
  482:     FILE_Copts = [return, {i,Dir},{outdir,Dir}],
  483:     {ok, file_5362, []} = compile:file(FILE_incl, FILE_Copts),
  484:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(FILE_incl, ".erl"),
  485:     {module, FILE_Mod} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, FILE_Mod),
  486:     II = FILE_Mod:ii(),
  487:     "file_incl_5362.erl" = filename:basename(II),
  488:     FF = FILE_Mod:ff(),
  489:     "other_file" = filename:basename(FF),
  490:     code:purge(file_5362),
  491: 
  492:     file:delete(FILE_incl),
  493:     file:delete(FILE_incl1),
  494: 
  495:     ok.
  496: 
  497: pmod(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  498:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  499:     Pmod = filename:join(DataDir, "pmod.erl"),
  500:     case epp:parse_file([Pmod], [], []) of
  501: 	      {ok,Forms} ->
  502: 		  %% io:format("~p\n", [Forms]),
  503: 		  [] = [F || {error,_}=F <- Forms],
  504: 		  ok
  505: 	  end,
  506:     ok.
  507: 
  508: not_circular(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     %% Used to generate a compilation error, wrongly saying that it
  510:     %% was a circular definition.
  511: 
  512:     Ts = [{circular_1,
  513:            <<"-define(S(S), ??S).\n"
  514:              "t() -> \"string\" = ?S(string), ok.\n">>,
  515:            ok}],
  516:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: %% Skip some bytes in the beginning of the file.
  520: skip_header(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  521:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  522:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "epp_test_skip_header.erl"]),
  523:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  524: 			       <<"some bytes
  525:                                   in the beginning of the file
  526:                                   that should be skipped
  527:                                   -module(epp_test_skip_header).
  528:                                   -export([main/1]).
  529: 
  530:                                   main(_) -> ?MODULE.
  531: 
  532:                                   ">>),
  533:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
  534:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  535:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  536:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  537:     {ok, Epp} = epp:open([{fd, Fd}, {name, list_to_atom(File)}, {location, 4}]),
  538: 
  539:     Forms = epp:parse_file(Epp),
  540:     [] = [Reason || {error, Reason} <- Forms],
  541:     ok = epp:close(Epp),
  542:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  543: 
  544:     ok.
  545:

  548:     Ts = [{otp_6277,
  549:            <<"-undef(ASSERT).
  550:               -define(ASSERT, ?MODULE).
  551:

  555:     ok.

  558: %% considered defined.

  560:     Ts = [{gh_4995,
  561:            <<"-ifdef(MODULE).
  562:               -record(r, {x = ?MODULE}).
  563:               -endif.">>,
  564:            []}],
  565:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  566:     ok.

  570:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),

  581:                        after 10000 ->

  583:                        end).

  585:                        ?RECEIVE(foo, bar).">>,
  586:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents),

  876:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8130.erl"),
  877:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  878:                                "-module(otp_8130).\n"
  879:                                "-define(a, 3.14).\n"
  880:                                "t() -> ?a.\n"),
  881:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  882:     PreDefMacs = macs(Epp),
  883:     ['BASE_MODULE','BASE_MODULE_STRING','BEAM',
  884:      'FEATURE_AVAILABLE', 'FEATURE_ENABLED','FILE',
  885:      'FUNCTION_ARITY','FUNCTION_NAME',
  886:      'LINE','MACHINE','MODULE','MODULE_STRING',
  887:      'OTP_RELEASE'] = PreDefMacs,
  888:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,file}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  889:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,module}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  890:     {ok,[{atom,_,t}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  891:     {eof,_} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  892:     [a] = macs(Epp) -- PreDefMacs,
  893:     epp:close(Epp),
  894: 
  895:     %% escript
  896:     ModuleStr = "any_name",
  897:     Module = list_to_atom(ModuleStr),
  898:     fun() ->
  899:             PreDefMacros = [{'MODULE', Module, redefine},
  900:                             {'MODULE_STRING', ModuleStr, redefine},
  901:                             a, {b,2}],
  902:             {ok,Epp2} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros),
  903:             [{atom,_,true}] = macro(Epp2, a),
  904:             [{integer,_,2}] = macro(Epp2, b),
  905:             false = macro(Epp2, c),
  906:             epp:close(Epp2)
  907:     end(),
  908:     fun() ->
  909:             PreDefMacros = [{a,b,c}],
  910:             {error,{bad,{a,b,c}}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  911:     end(),
  912:     fun() ->
  913:             PreDefMacros = [a, {a,1}],
  914:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  915:     end(),
  916:     fun() ->
  917:             PreDefMacros = [{a,1},a],
  918:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  919:     end(),
  920: 
  921:     {error,enoent} = epp:open("no such file", []),
  922:     {error,enoent} = epp:parse_file("no such file", [], []),
  923: 
  924:     _ = ifdef(Config),
  925: 
  926:     ok.
  927: 
  928: scan_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  929:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  930:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
  931: 
  932:     {ok, Toks, [{encoding, _}]} = epp:scan_file(File, []),
  933:     [FileForm1, ModuleForm, ExportForm,
  934:      FileForm2, FileForm3, FunctionForm,
  935:      {eof,_}] = Toks,
  936:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm1,
  937:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,module}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ModuleForm,
  938:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,export}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ExportForm,
  939:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm2,
  940:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm3,
  941:     ok.
  942: 
  943: macs(Epp) ->
  944:     Macros = epp:macro_defs(Epp), % not documented
  945:     lists:sort([MName || {{atom,MName},_} <- Macros]).
  946: 
  947: macro(Epp, N) ->
  948:     case lists:keyfind({atom,N}, 1, epp:macro_defs(Epp)) of
  949:         false -> false;
  950:         {{atom,N},{_,V}} -> V;
  951:         {{atom,N},Defs} -> lists:append([V || {_,{_,V}} <- Defs])
  952:     end.
  953: 
  954: ifdef(Config) ->
  955:     Cs = [{ifdef_c1,
  956:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  957:              "a bug.\n"
  958:              "-else.\n"
  959:              "-ifdef(A).\n"
  960:              "a bug.\n"
  961:              "-endif.\n"
  962:              "-else.\n"
  963:              "t() -> ok.\n"
  964:              "-endif.">>,
  965:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
  966: 
  967:           {ifdef_c2,
  968:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
  969:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
  970:              "a bug.\n"
  971:              "-endif.">>,
  972:            {errors,[{{3,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","bug"]}],[]}},
  973: 
  974:           {ifdef_c3,
  975:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
  976:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
  977:              "-endif">>,
  978: 
  979:            {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
  980:                     {{3,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],
  981:           []}},
  982: 
  983:           {ifdef_c4,
  984:            <<"\n-ifdef a.\n"
  985:              "-endif.\n">>,
  986:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,ifdef}}],[]}},
  987: 
  988:           {ifdef_c5,
  989:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  990:              "-else.\n"
  991:              "-endif.\n"
  992:              "-endif.\n">>,
  993:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",endif}}],[]}},
  994: 
  995:           {ifdef_c6,
  996:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  997:              "-else.\n"
  998:              "-endif.\n"
  999:              "-else.\n">>,
 1000:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'else'}}],[]}},
 1001: 
 1002:           {ifdef_c7,
 1003:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1004:              "-else\n"
 1005:              "foo bar\n"
 1006:              "-else.\n"
 1007:              "t() -> a.\n"
 1008:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1009:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,{bad,'else'}}],[]}},
 1010: 
 1011:           {ifdef_c8,
 1012:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1013:               "-foo bar.">>,
 1014:            {errors,[{{2,10},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],[]}},
 1015: 
 1016:           {ifdef_c9,
 1017:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1018:               "3.3e12000.\n"
 1019:               "-endif.\n">>,
 1020:            []},
 1021: 
 1022:           {ifdef_c10,
 1023:            <<"\nt() -> 3.3e12000.\n">>,
 1024:            {errors,[{{2,8},erl_scan,{illegal,float}},
 1025:                     {{2,17},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}], % ...
 1026:             []}},
 1027: 
 1028:           {ifndef_c1,
 1029:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1030:              "-ifndef(A).\n"
 1031:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1032:              "-endif.\n"
 1033:              "-else.\n"
 1034:              "a bug.\n"
 1035:              "-else.\n"
 1036:              "a bug.\n"
 1037:              "-endif.">>,
 1038:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
 1039: 
 1040:           {ifndef_c3,
 1041:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1042:              "-endif">>,
 1043: 
 1044:            {errors,[{{2,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
 1045:                     {{2,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifndef}}],
 1046:           []}},
 1047: 
 1048:           {ifndef_c4,
 1049:            <<"\n-ifndef a.\n"
 1050:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1051:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{bad,ifndef}}],[]}},
 1052: 
 1053:           {define_c5,
 1054:            <<"-\ndefine a.\n">>,
 1055:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,define}}],[]}}
 1056:           ],
 1057:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1058: 
 1059:     Ts =  [{ifdef_1,
 1060:             <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1061:               "a bug.\n"
 1062:               "-else.\n"
 1063:               "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1064:               "a bug.\n"
 1065:               "-endif.\n"
 1066:               "t() -> ok.\n"
 1067:               "-endif.">>,
 1068:            ok},
 1069: 
 1070:            {ifdef_2,
 1071:             <<"-define(a, true).\n"
 1072:               "-ifdef(a).\n"
 1073:               "-define(A, true).\n"
 1074:               "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1075:               "t() -> ok.\n"
 1076:               "-else.\n"
 1077:               "a bug.\n"
 1078:               "-endif.\n"
 1079:               "-else.\n"
 1080:               "a bug.\n"
 1081:               "-endif.">>,
 1082:            ok},
 1083: 
 1084:            {ifdef_3,
 1085:             <<"\n-define(a, true).\n"
 1086:               "-ifndef(a).\n"
 1087:               "a bug.\n"
 1088:               "-else.\n"
 1089:               "-define(A, true).\n"
 1090:               "-ifndef(A).\n"

 1092:               "-else.\n"

 1094:               "-endif.\n"
 1095:               "-endif.">>,
 1096:            ok},

 1144: 	     "-ifdef(NOT_DEFINED).\n"
 1145: 	     " -error(\"this one will be skipped\").\n"

 1151: 	     " t() -> a.\n"
 1152: 	     "-else.\n"

 1154: 	     " t() -> b.\n"
 1155: 	     "-else.\n"
 1156: 	     "-error(\"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available\").\n"
 1157: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1158: 	     "-endif.\n">>,

 1200: %% OTP-12847: Test the -if and -elif directives and the built-in
 1201: %% function defined(Symbol).
 1202: test_if(Config) ->
 1203:     Cs = [{if_1c,
 1204: 	   <<"-if.\n"
 1205: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1206: 	     "-if no_parentheses.\n"
 1207: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1208: 	     "-if(syntax error.\n"
 1209: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1210: 	     "-if(true).\n"
 1211: 	     "-if(a+3).\n"
 1212: 	     "syntax error not triggered here.\n"
 1213: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1214:            {errors,[{{1,23},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1215: 		    {{3,5},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1216: 		    {{5,12},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","error"]},
 1217: 		    {{11,1},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",'if'}}],
 1218: 	    []}},
 1219: 
 1220: 	  {if_2c,			       	%Bad guard expressions.
 1221: 	   <<"-if(is_list(integer_to_list(42))).\n" %Not guard BIF.
 1222: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1223: 	     "-if(begin true end).\n"
 1224: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1225: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1226: 		    {{3,2},epp,{bad,'if'}}],
 1227: 	    []}},
 1228: 
 1229: 	  {if_3c,			       	%Invalid use of defined/1.
 1230: 	   <<"-if defined(42).\n"
 1231: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1232: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1233: 
 1234: 	  {if_4c,
 1235: 	   <<"-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n">>,
 1236: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1237: 
 1238: 	  {if_5c,
 1239: 	   <<"-ifdef(not_defined_today).\n"
 1240: 	     "-else.\n"
 1241: 	     "-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n"
 1242: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1243: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1244: 
 1245: 	  {if_6c,
 1246: 	   <<"-if(defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1247: 	     "-else.\n"
 1248: 	     "-elif(true).\n"
 1249: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1250: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,elif_after_else}],[]}},
 1251: 
 1252: 	  {if_7c,
 1253: 	   <<"-if(begin true end).\n"		%Not a guard expression.
 1254: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1255: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1256: 
 1257: 	  {if_8c,
 1258: 	   <<"-if(?foo).\n"                     %Undefined symbol.
 1259: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1260: 	   {errors,[{{1,25},epp,{undefined,foo,none}}],[]}}
 1261: 
 1262: 	 ],
 1263:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1264: 
 1265:     Ts = [{if_1,
 1266: 	   <<"-if(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1267: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1268: 	     "-else.\n"
 1269: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1270: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1271:            ok},
 1272: 
 1273: 	  {if_2,
 1274: 	   <<"-if(false).\n"
 1275: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1276: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1277: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1278: 	     "-else.\n"
 1279: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1280: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1281:            ok},
 1282: 
 1283: 	  {if_3,
 1284: 	   <<"-if(true).\n"
 1285: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1286: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1287: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1288: 	     "-else.\n"
 1289: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1290: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1291:            ok},
 1292:

 1294: 	   <<"-define(a, 1).\n"
 1295: 	     "-if(defined(a) andalso defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1296: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1297: 	     "-else.\n"
 1298: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1299: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1300:            ok},
 1301:

 1304: 	     "a bug.\n"

 1307: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1308:            ok},

 1346: %% Advanced test on overloading macros.
 1347: overload_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1348:     Cs = [
 1349:           %% '-undef' removes all definitions of a macro
 1350:           {overload_mac_c1,
 1351:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1352:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1353:             "-undef(A).\n"
 1354:             "t1() -> ?A.\n",
 1355:             "t2() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1356:            {errors,[{{4,10},epp,{undefined,'A', none}},
 1357:                     {{5,10},epp,{undefined,'A', 1}}],[]}},
 1358: 
 1359:           %% cannot overload predefined macros
 1360:           {overload_mac_c2,
 1361:            <<"\n-define(MODULE(X), X).">>,
 1362:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'MODULE'}}],[]}},
 1363: 
 1364:           %% cannot overload macros with same arity
 1365:           {overload_mac_c3,
 1366:            <<"-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1367:             "-define(A(Y), Y).">>,
 1368:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine,'A'}}],[]}},
 1369: 
 1370:           {overload_mac_c4,
 1371:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1372:             "-define(A(X,Y), {X,Y}).\n"
 1373:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1374:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1375:            {errors,[{{4,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}}
 1376:          ],
 1377:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1378: 
 1379:     Ts = [
 1380:           {overload_mac_r1,
 1381:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1382:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1383:             "-define(A(X, Y), {X, Y}).\n"
 1384:             "t() -> {?A, ?A(2), ?A(3, 4)}.">>,
 1385:            {1, 2, {3, 4}}},
 1386: 
 1387:           {overload_mac_r2,
 1388:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1389:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1390:             "t() -> ?A(?A).">>,
 1391:            1},
 1392: 
 1393:           {overload_mac_r3,
 1394:            <<"-define(A, ?B).\n"
 1395:             "-define(B, a).\n"
 1396:             "-define(B(X), {b,X}).\n"
 1397:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1398:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1399:            1}
 1400:           ],
 1401:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 1402:

 1404: %% OTP-8388. More tests on overloaded macros.
 1405: otp_8388(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1406:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1407:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8388.erl"),
 1408:     ok = file:write_file(File, <<"-module(otp_8388)."
 1409:                                        "-define(LINE, a).">>),
 1410:     fun() ->
 1411:             PreDefMacros = [{'LINE', a}],
 1412:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1413:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1414:     end(),
 1415: 
 1416:     fun() ->
 1417:             PreDefMacros = ['LINE'],
 1418:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1419:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1420:     end(),
 1421: 
 1422:     Ts = [
 1423:           {macro_1,
 1424:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1425:              "t() -> ?m(,).\n">>,
 1426:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1427:           {macro_2,
 1428:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1429:              "t() -> ?m(a,).\n">>,
 1430:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1431:           {macro_3,
 1432:            <<"\n-define(LINE, a).\n">>,
 1433:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}}],[]}},
 1434:           {macro_4,
 1435:            <<"-define(A(B, C, D), {B,C,D}).\n"
 1436:              "t() -> ?A(a,,3).\n">>,
 1437:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}},
 1438:           {macro_5,
 1439:            <<"-define(Q, {?F0(), ?F1(,,4)}).\n">>,
 1440:            {errors,[{{1,40},epp,{arg_error,'F1'}}],[]}},
 1441:           {macro_6,
 1442:            <<"-define(FOO(X), ?BAR(X)).\n"
 1443:              "-define(BAR(X), ?FOO(X)).\n"
 1444:              "-undef(FOO).\n"
 1445:              "test() -> ?BAR(1).\n">>,
 1446:            {errors,[{{4,12},epp,{undefined,'FOO',1}}],[]}}
 1447:          ],
 1448:     [] = compile(Config, Ts),
 1449:     ok.

 1474: %% OTP-8911. -file and file inclusion bug.
 1475: otp_8911(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1476:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1477: 	true ->
 1478: 	    {skip, "Testing cover, so cannot run when cover is already running"};
 1479: 	false ->
 1480: 	    do_otp_8911(Config)
 1481:     end.
 1482: do_otp_8911(Config) ->
 1483:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1484:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1485: 
 1486:     File = "i.erl",
 1487:     Cont = <<"-module(i).
 1488:               -export([t/0]).
 1489:               -file(\"fil1\", 100).
 1490:               -include(\"i1.erl\").
 1491:               t() ->
 1492:                   a.
 1493:            ">>,
 1494:     ok = file:write_file(File, Cont),
 1495:     Incl = <<"-file(\"fil2\", 35).
 1496:               t1() ->
 1497:                   b.
 1498:            ">>,
 1499:     File1 = "i1.erl",
 1500:     ok = file:write_file(File1, Incl),
 1501: 
 1502:     {ok, i} = cover:compile(File),
 1503:     a = i:t(),
 1504:     {ok,[{{i,6},1}]} = cover:analyse(i, calls, line),
 1505:     cover:stop(),
 1506: 
 1507:     file:delete(File),
 1508:     file:delete(File1),
 1509:     file:set_cwd(CWD),
 1510:     ok.
 1511:

 1516:            {errors,[{{2,13},epp,premature_end}],[]}}

 1519:     ok.
 1520: 
 1521: %% OTP-10302. Unicode characters scanner/parser.
 1522: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1523:     %% Two messages (one too many). Keeps otp_4871 happy.
 1524:     Cs = [{otp_10302,
 1525:            <<"%% coding: utf-8\n \n \x{E4}">>,
 1526:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,cannot_parse},
 1527:                     {{3,1},file_io_server,invalid_unicode}],[]}}
 1528:          ],
 1529:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1530:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1531:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_10302.erl"),
 1532:     utf8 = encoding("coding: utf-8", File),
 1533:     utf8 = encoding("coding: UTF-8", File),
 1534:     latin1 = encoding("coding: Latin-1", File),
 1535:     latin1 = encoding("coding: latin-1", File),
 1536:     none = encoding_com("coding: utf-8", File),
 1537:     none = encoding_com("\n\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1538:     none = encoding_nocom("\n\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1539:     utf8 = encoding_com("\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1540:     utf8 = encoding_nocom("\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1541:     none = encoding("coding: \nutf-8", File),
 1542:     latin1 = encoding("Encoding :  latin-1", File),
 1543:     utf8 = encoding("ccoding: UTF-8", File),
 1544:     utf8 = encoding("coding= utf-8", File),
 1545:     utf8 = encoding_com(" %% coding= utf-8", File),
 1546:     utf8 = encoding("coding  =  utf-8", File),
 1547:     none = encoding("coding: utf-16 coding: utf-8", File), %first is bad
 1548:     none = encoding("Coding: utf-8", File),    %capital c
 1549:     utf8 = encoding("-*- coding: utf-8 -*-", File),
 1550:     utf8 = encoding("-*-coding= utf-8-*-", File),
 1551:     utf8 = encoding("codingcoding= utf-8", File),
 1552:     ok = prefix("coding: utf-8", File, utf8),
 1553: 
 1554:     "coding: latin-1" = epp:encoding_to_string(latin1),
 1555:     "coding: utf-8" = epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),
 1556:     true = lists:member(epp:default_encoding(), [latin1, utf8]),
 1557: 
 1558:     ok.
 1559: 
 1560: prefix(S, File, Enc) ->
 1561:     prefix(0, S, File, Enc).
 1562: 
 1563: prefix(100, _S, _File, _) ->
 1564:     ok;
 1565: prefix(N, S, File, Enc) ->
 1566:     Enc = encoding(lists:duplicate(N, $\s) ++ S, File),
 1567:     prefix(N+1, S, File, Enc).
 1568: 
 1569: encoding(Enc, File) ->
 1570:     E = encoding_com("%% " ++ Enc, File),
 1571:     none = encoding_com(Enc, File),
 1572:     E = encoding_nocom(Enc, File).
 1573: 
 1574: encoding_com(Enc, File) ->
 1575:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1576:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B),
 1577:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1578:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1579:     E = epp:set_encoding(Fd),
 1580:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1581:     E = epp:read_encoding(File).
 1582: 
 1583: encoding_nocom(Enc, File) ->
 1584:     Options = [{in_comment_only, false}],
 1585:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1586:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B, Options),
 1587:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1588:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1589:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1590:     E = epp:read_encoding(File, Options).
 1591: 
 1592: %% OTP-10820. Unicode filenames.
 1593: otp_10820(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1594:     L = [915,953,959,973,957,953,954,959,957,964],
 1595:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1596:     File = filename:join(Dir, L++".erl"),
 1597:     C1 = <<"%% coding: utf-8\n -module(any).">>,
 1598:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1599:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "unicode"]),
 1600:     C2 = <<"\n-module(any).">>,
 1601:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1602:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "unicode"]).
 1603: 
 1604: do_otp_10820(File, C, PC) ->
 1605:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"] ++ PC),
 1606:     ok = rpc:call(Node, file, write_file, [File, C]),
 1607:     {ok, Forms} = rpc:call(Node, epp, parse_file, [File, [],[]]),
 1608:     [{attribute,1,file,{File,1}},
 1609:      {attribute,2,module,any},
 1610:      {eof,2}] = unopaque_forms(Forms),
 1611:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1612:     ok.
 1613:

 1616:     %% This is just a sample of errors.

 1618:            <<"-export([f/0]).
 1619:               -define('a\x{400}b', 'a\x{400}d').
 1620:               f() ->
 1621:                   ?'a\x{400}b'.
 1622:               g() ->
 1623:                   ?\"a\x{400}b\".
 1624:               h() ->
 1625:                   ?'a\x{400}no'().
 1626:               "/utf8>>,
 1627:            {errors,[{{6,20},epp,{call,[63,[91,["97",44,"1024",44,"98"],93]]}},
 1628:                     {{8,20},epp,{undefined,'a\x{400}no',0}}],
 1629:             []}}
 1630:          ],
 1631:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1632:     ok.

 1634: %% OTP-11728. Bugfix circular macro.
 1635: otp_11728(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1636:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1637:     H = <<"-define(MACRO,[[]++?MACRO]).">>,
 1638:     HrlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.hrl"),
 1639:     ok = file:write_file(HrlFile, H),
 1640:     C = <<"-module(otp_11728).
 1641:            -export([function_name/0]).
 1642: 
 1643:            -include(\"otp_11728.hrl\").
 1644: 
 1645:            function_name()->
 1646:                A=?MACRO, % line 7
 1647:                ok">>,
 1648:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.erl"),
 1649:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C),
 1650:     {ok, L} = epp:parse_file(ErlFile, [Dir], []),
 1651:     true = lists:member({error,{7,epp,{circular,'MACRO',none}}}, L),
 1652:     _ = file:delete(HrlFile),
 1653:     _ = file:delete(ErlFile),
 1654:     ok.

 1656: %% Check the new API for setting the default encoding.
 1657: encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1658:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1659:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "encoding.erl"),
 1660: 
 1661:     %% Try a latin-1 file with no encoding given.
 1662:     C1 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1663:            %% ",246,"
 1664: 	  ">>,
 1665:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C1),
 1666:     {ok,[{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
 1667: 	 {attribute,{1,2},module,encoding},
 1668: 	 {error,_},
 1669: 	 {error,{{2,12},epp,cannot_parse}},
 1670: 	 {eof,{2,12}}]} = epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{location, {1,1}}]),
 1671:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1672: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1673: 	 {eof,3}]} =
 1674: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1675:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1676: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1677: 	 {eof,3}],Extra0} =
 1678: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1679:     none = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra0),
 1680: 
 1681:     %% Try a latin-1 file with encoding given in a comment.
 1682:     C2 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1683:            %% encoding: latin-1
 1684:            %% ",246,"
 1685: 	  ">>,
 1686:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C2),
 1687:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1688: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1689: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1690: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, []),
 1691:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1692: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1693: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1694: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1695:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1696: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1697: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1698: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8}]),
 1699:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1700: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1701: 	 {eof,4}],Extra1} =
 1702: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [extra]),
 1703:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra1),
 1704: 
 1705:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1706: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1707: 	 {eof,4}],Extra2} =
 1708: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1709:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra2),
 1710:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1711: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1712: 	 {eof,4}],Extra3} =
 1713: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8},extra]),
 1714:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra3),
 1715:     ok.

 2061: gh_8268(Config) ->
 2062:     Ts = [{circular_1,
 2063:            <<"-define(LOG(Tag, Code), io:format(\"~s\", [Tag]), Code).
 2064:              more_work() -> ok.
 2065:              some_work() -> ok.
 2066:              t() ->
 2067:                 ?LOG(work,
 2068:                      begin
 2069:                         maybe
 2070:                            ok ?= some_work()
 2071:                         end,
 2072:                         more_work()
 2073:                      end).
 2074:              ">>,
 2075:            [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}],
 2076:            ok}],
 2077:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2078:     ok.
 2079: 
 2080: %% Start location is 1.
 2081: check(Config, Tests) ->
 2082:     eval_tests(Config, fun check_test/3, Tests).
 2083: 
 2084: %% Start location is {1,1}.
 2085: compile(Config, Tests) ->
 2086:     eval_tests(Config, fun compile_test/3, Tests).
 2087: 
 2088: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2089:     eval_tests(Config, fun run_test/3, Tests).
 2090: 
 2091: eval_tests(Config, Fun, Tests) ->
 2092:     TestsWithOpts =
 2093:         [case Test of
 2094:              {N,P,E} ->
 2095:                  {N,P,[],E};
 2096:              {_,_,_,_} ->
 2097:                  Test
 2098:          end || Test <- Tests],
 2099:     F = fun({N,P,Opts,E}, BadL) ->
 2100:                 %% io:format("Testing ~p~n", [P]),
 2101:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, Opts),
 2102:                 %% The result should be the same when enabling maybe ... end
 2103:                 %% (making 'else' a keyword instead of an atom).
 2104:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}|Opts]),
 2105:                 case message_compare(E, Return) of
 2106:                     true ->
 2107:                         case E of
 2108:                             {errors, Errors} ->
 2109:                                 call_format_error(Errors);
 2110:                             _ ->
 2111:                                 ok
 2112:                         end,
 2113:                         BadL;
 2114:                     false ->
 2115:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2116:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Return]),
 2117: 			fail()
 2118:                 end
 2119:         end,
 2120:     lists:foldl(F, [], TestsWithOpts).
 2121: 
 2122: check_test(Config, Test, Opts) ->
 2123:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2124:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2125:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2126:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2127:     case epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, PrivDir}| Opts]) of
 2128: 	{ok,Forms} ->
 2129: 	    Errors = [E || E={error,_} <- Forms],
 2130: 	    call_format_error([E || {error,E} <- Errors]),
 2131: 	    Errors;
 2132: 	{error,Error} ->
 2133: 	    Error
 2134:     end.
 2135: 
 2136: compile_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2137:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). ">>, Test0],
 2138:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2139:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2140:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2141:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2142:     Opts = [export_all,nowarn_export_all,return,nowarn_unused_record,{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2143:     case compile_file(File, Opts) of
 2144:         {ok, Ws} -> warnings(File, Ws);
 2145:         {errors, Errors}=Else ->
 2146:             call_format_error(Errors),
 2147:             Else;
 2148:         Else -> Else
 2149:     end.
 2150: 
 2151: warnings(File, Ws) ->
 2152:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 2153:         [] ->
 2154: 	    [];
 2155:         L ->
 2156: 	    call_format_error(L),
 2157: 	    {warnings, L}
 2158:     end.
 2159: 
 2160: compile_file(File, Opts) ->
 2161:     case compile:file(File, Opts) of
 2162:         {ok, _M, Ws} -> {ok, Ws};
 2163:         {error, FEs, []} -> {errors, errs(FEs, File), []};
 2164:         {error, FEs, [{File,Ws}]} -> {error, errs(FEs, File), Ws}
 2165:     end.
 2166: 
 2167: errs([{File,Es}|L], File) ->
 2168:     call_format_error(Es),
 2169:     Es ++ errs(L, File);
 2170: errs([_|L], File) ->
 2171:     errs(L, File);
 2172: errs([], _File) ->
 2173:     [].
 2174: 
 2175: %% Smoke test and coverage of format_error/1.
 2176: call_format_error([{_,M,E}|T]) ->
 2177:     _ = M:format_error(E),
 2178:     call_format_error(T);
 2179: call_format_error([]) ->
 2180:     ok.
 2181: 
 2182: epp_parse_file(File, Opts) ->
 2183:     case epp:parse_file(File, Opts) of
 2184:         {ok, Forms} ->
 2185:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms)};
 2186:         {ok, Forms, Other} ->
 2187:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms), Other}
 2188:     end.
 2189: 
 2190: unopaque_forms(Forms) ->
 2191:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 2192: 
 2193: run_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2194:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). -export([t/0]). ">>, Test0],
 2195:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2196:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2197:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2198:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2199:     Opts = [return, {i,PrivDir},{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2200:     {ok, epp_test, []} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2201:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(File, ".erl"),
 2202: 
 2203:     case lists:member({feature, maybe_expr, enable}, Opts0) of
 2204:         false ->
 2205:             %% Run in node
 2206:             {module, epp_test} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, epp_test),
 2207:             Reply = epp_test:t(),
 2208:             code:purge(epp_test),
 2209:             Reply;
 2210:         true ->
 2211:             %% Run in peer with maybe_expr enabled
 2212:             {ok, Peer, Node} =
 2213:                 ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-enable-feature","maybe_expr"],
 2214:                            connection => 0}),
 2215:             {module, epp_test} =
 2216:                 rpc:call(Node, code, load_abs, [AbsFile, epp_test]),
 2217:             Reply = rpc:call(Node, epp_test, t, []),
 2218:             peer:stop(Peer),
 2219:             Reply
 2220:     end.
 2221: 
 2222: fail() ->
 2223:     ct:fail(failed).
 2224: 
 2225: message_compare(T, T) ->
 2226:     T =:= T.
